channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Uniform Convergence of Lipschitz Functions with Dependent Gaussian Samples
item.description: In many practical learning problems, training samples are not i. i. d., and there is an intrinsic dependency among samples.

item.title: Enhancing Time Series Forecasting via Multi-Level Text Alignment with LLMs
item.description: The adaptation of large language models (LLMs) to time series forecasting poses unique challenges, as time series data is continuous in nature, while LLMs operate on discrete tokens.

item.title: LoRI: Reducing Cross-Task Interference in Multi-Task Low-Rank Adaptation
item.description: We propose LoRA with Reduced Interference (LoRI), a simple yet effective approach that freezes the projection matrices $A$ as random projections and sparsifies the matrices $B$ using task-specific masks.

item.title: Automating quantum feature map design via large language models
item.description: Quantum feature maps are a key component of quantum machine learning, encoding classical data into quantum states to exploit the expressive power of high-dimensional Hilbert spaces.

item.title: PhaseGen: A Diffusion-Based Approach for Complex-Valued MRI Data Generation
item.description: In this work, we introduce $\textit{PhaseGen}$, a novel complex-valued diffusion model for generating synthetic MRI raw data conditioned on magnitude images, commonly used in clinical practice.

item.title: Benchmarking Adversarial Robustness to Bias Elicitation in Large Language Models: Scalable Automated Assessment with LLM-as-a-Judge
item.description: Our findings reveal critical trade-offs between model size and safety, aiding the development of fairer and more robust future language models.

item.title: Kaleidoscope: In-language Exams for Massively Multilingual Vision Evaluation
item.description: The evaluation of vision-language models (VLMs) has mainly relied on English-language benchmarks, leaving significant gaps in both multilingual and multicultural coverage.

item.title: DDT: Decoupled Diffusion Transformer
item.description: For ImageNet $256\times256$, Our DDT-XL/2 achieves a new state-of-the-art performance of {1. 31 FID}~(nearly $4\times$ faster training convergence compared to previous diffusion transformers).

item.title: ColorizeDiffusion v2: Enhancing Reference-based Sketch Colorization Through Separating Utilities
item.description: To address this limitation, we conduct an in-depth analysis of the \textbf{carrier}, defined as the latent representation facilitating information transfer from reference to sketch.

item.title: Adapting GT2-FLS for Uncertainty Quantification: A Blueprint Calibration Strategy
item.description: Uncertainty Quantification (UQ) is crucial for deploying reliable Deep Learning (DL) models in high-stakes applications.

item.title: Latent Diffusion U-Net Representations Contain Positional Embeddings and Anomalies
item.description: Diffusion models have demonstrated remarkable capabilities in synthesizing realistic images, spurring interest in using their representations for various downstream tasks.

item.title: Multi-Modality Sensing in mmWave Beamforming for Connected Vehicles Using Deep Learning
item.description: Beamforming techniques are considered as essential parts to compensate severe path losses in millimeter-wave (mmWave) communications.

item.title: Gaze-Guided Learning: Avoiding Shortcut Bias in Visual Classification
item.description: Motivated by this, we introduce Gaze-CIFAR-10, a human gaze time-series dataset, along with a dual-sequence gaze encoder that models the precise sequential localization of human attention on distinct local attributes.

item.title: Rethinking the Nested U-Net Approach: Enhancing Biomarker Segmentation with Attention Mechanisms and Multiscale Feature Fusion
item.description: Identifying biomarkers in medical images is vital for a wide range of biotech applications.

item.title: HRMedSeg: Unlocking High-resolution Medical Image segmentation via Memory-efficient Attention Modeling
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose a memory-efficient framework for high-resolution medical image segmentation, called HRMedSeg.

item.title: OmniEcon Nexus: Global Microeconomic Simulation Engine
item.description: Risk Analysis: Assesses market volatility and systemic risk using network analysis.

item.title: Not All Data Are Unlearned Equally
item.description: Machine unlearning is concerned with the task of removing knowledge learned from particular data points from a trained model.

item.title: Caption Anything in Video: Fine-grained Object-centric Captioning via Spatiotemporal Multimodal Prompting
item.description: We present CAT-V (Caption AnyThing in Video), a training-free framework for fine-grained object-centric video captioning that enables detailed descriptions of user-selected objects through time.

item.title: TabRep: a Simple and Effective Continuous Representation for Training Tabular Diffusion Models
item.description: Ultimately, TabRep provides a simple yet effective approach for training tabular diffusion models under a continuous data manifold.

item.title: BoxSeg: Quality-Aware and Peer-Assisted Learning for Box-supervised Instance Segmentation
item.description: Box-supervised instance segmentation methods aim to achieve instance segmentation with only box annotations.

item.title: VoTranh-Abyss-Core-Micro: The Supreme AI for Real-Time Financial Forecasting – Conquer Markets Now
item.description: Welcome to the future of microeconomics!

item.title: A Reinforcement Learning Method for Environments with Stochastic Variables: Post-Decision Proximal Policy Optimization with Dual Critic Networks
item.description: Integrating this post-decision state in the value function approximation leads to more informed and efficient learning in high-dimensional and stochastic environments.

item.title: SAD-Net: a full spectral self-attention detail enhancement network for single image dehazing
item.description: However, existing dehazing methods using vanilla convolution only extract features in the temporal domain and lack the ability to capture multi-directional information.

item.title: Stereo-LiDAR Fusion by Semi-Global Matching With Discrete Disparity-Matching Cost and Semidensification
item.description: We present a real-time, non-learning depth estimation method that fuses Light Detection and Ranging (LiDAR) data with stereo camera input.

item.title: Climplicit: Climatic Implicit Embeddings for Global Ecological Tasks
item.description: Deep learning on climatic data holds potential for macroecological applications.

item.title: Lightweight and Direct Document Relevance Optimization for Generative Information Retrieval
item.description: Generative information retrieval (GenIR) is a promising neural retrieval paradigm that formulates document retrieval as a document identifier (docid) generation task, allowing for end-to-end optimization toward a unified global retrieval objective.

item.title: DFormerv2: Geometry Self-Attention for RGBD Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Taking into account that depth can be regarded as a geometry supplement for RGB images, a straightforward question arises: Do we really need to explicitly encode depth information with neural networks as done for RGB images?

item.title: SAM2MOT: A Novel Paradigm of Multi-Object Tracking by Segmentation
item.description: To extend this to multi-object tracking (MOT), we propose SAM2MOT, introducing a novel Tracking by Segmentation paradigm.

item.title: Extending Cox Proportional Hazards Model with Symbolic Non-Linear Log-Risk Functions for Survival Analysis
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Generalized Cox Proportional Hazards (GCPH) model, a novel method for survival analysis that leverages KAN to enable a non-linear mapping from covariates to survival outcomes in a fully symbolic manner.

item.title: Enhance Then Search: An Augmentation-Search Strategy with Foundation Models for Cross-Domain Few-Shot Object Detection
item.description: Foundation models pretrained on extensive datasets, such as GroundingDINO and LAE-DINO, have performed remarkably in the cross-domain few-shot object detection (CD-FSOD) task.

item.title: Hessian of Perplexity for Large Language Models by PyTorch autograd (Open Source)
item.description: Computing the full Hessian matrix -- the matrix of second-order derivatives for an entire Large Language Model (LLM) is infeasible due to its sheer size.

item.title: Detection-Friendly Nonuniformity Correction: A Union Framework for Infrared UAVTarget Detection
item.description: To better balance correction and detection, we introduce a detection-guided self-supervised loss to reduce feature discrepancies between the two tasks, thereby enhancing detection robustness to varying nonuniformity levels.

item.title: FlexChunk: Enabling 100M×100M Out-of-Core SpMV (~1.8 min, ~1.7 GB RAM) with Near-Linear Scaling
item.description: Handling large-scale sparse matrices is a fundamental task in many scientific and engineering domains, yet standard in-memory approaches often hit the limitations of available RAM.

item.title: MSL: Not All Tokens Are What You Need for Tuning LLM as a Recommender
item.description: Large language models (LLMs), known for their comprehension capabilities and extensive knowledge, have been increasingly applied to recommendation systems (RS).

item.title: Lifting Factor Graphs with Some Unknown Factors for New Individuals
item.description: By incorporating such background knowledge, LIFAGU is able to further reduce the ambiguity of possible transfers of known potentials to unknown potentials.

item.title: Scaling Open-Vocabulary Action Detection
item.description: In this work, we focus on scaling open-vocabulary action detection.

item.title: Generative AI Enhanced Financial Risk Management Information Retrieval
item.description: This paper introduces RiskData, a dataset specifically curated for finetuning embedding models in risk management, and RiskEmbed, a finetuned embedding model designed to improve retrieval accuracy in financial question-answering systems.

item.title: TGraphX: Tensor-Aware Graph Neural Network for Multi-Dimensional Feature Learning
item.description: TGraphX presents a novel paradigm in deep learning by unifying convolutional neural networks (CNNs) with graph neural networks (GNNs) to enhance visual reasoning tasks.

item.title: Distillation and Refinement of Reasoning in Small Language Models for Document Re-ranking
item.description: We present a novel approach for training small language models for reasoning-intensive document ranking that combines knowledge distillation with reinforcement learning optimization.

item.title: On Symbol Error Probability-based Beamforming in MIMO Gaussian Wiretap Channels
item.description: This paper investigates beamforming schemes designed to minimize the symbol error probability (SEP) for an authorized user while guaranteeing that the likelihood of an eavesdropper correctly recovering symbols remains below a predefined threshold.

item.title: Learning-Based Conformal Tube MPC for Safe Control in Interactive Multi-Agent Systems
item.description: Safety assurance in multi-agent systems with coupled dynamics is a fundamental yet challenging problem, especially when agents exhibit uncertain and state-dependent behaviors.

item.title: DeepResearcher: Scaling Deep Research via Reinforcement Learning in Real-world Environments
item.description: In this paper, we introduce DeepResearcher, the first comprehensive framework for end-to-end training of LLM-based deep research agents through scaling reinforcement learning (RL) in real-world environments with authentic web search interactions.

item.title: Meta-DAN: towards an efficient prediction strategy for page-level handwritten text recognition
item.description: Recent advances in text recognition led to a paradigm shift for page-level recognition, from multi-step segmentation-based approaches to end-to-end attention-based ones.

item.title: Dense Neural Network Based Arrhythmia Classification on Low-cost and Low-compute Micro-controller
item.description: The electrocardiogram (ECG) monitoring device is an expensive albeit essential device for the treatment and diagnosis of cardiovascular diseases (CVD).

item.title: Steerable Anatomical Shape Synthesis with Implicit Neural Representations
item.description: Generative modeling of anatomical structures plays a crucial role in virtual imaging trials, which allow researchers to perform studies without the costs and constraints inherent to in vivo and phantom studies.

item.title: Noise Augmented Fine Tuning for Mitigating Hallucinations in Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) often produce inaccurate or misleading content-hallucinations.

item.title: SARLANG-1M: A Benchmark for Vision-Language Modeling in SAR Image Understanding
item.description: Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) is a crucial remote sensing technology, enabling all-weather, day-and-night observation with strong surface penetration for precise and continuous environmental monitoring and analysis.

item.title: AutoSSVH: Exploring Automated Frame Sampling for Efficient Self-Supervised Video Hashing
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose a new framework, termed AutoSSVH, that employs adversarial frame sampling with hash-based contrastive learning.

item.title: BitHEP -- The Limits of Low-Precision ML in HEP
item.description: The increasing complexity of modern neural network architectures demands fast and memory-efficient implementations to mitigate computational bottlenecks.

item.title: Mamba as a Bridge: Where Vision Foundation Models Meet Vision Language Models for Domain-Generalized Semantic Segmentation
item.description: However, existing DGSS methods often rely exclusively on either VFMs or VLMs, overlooking their complementary strengths.
